Summary: The company is a technology-enabled provider of gift card solutions, focusing on API platform strategy and IT modernization. The Head of Technology will lead digital platform architecture, product strategy, and technical debt remediation, reporting to the President.
Responsibilities: Own the vision and roadmap for the company's API platform and developer ecosystem. Gather feedback from merchants, vendors and internal teams, prioritize features and ensure the platform delivers measurable business value.
Serve as the lead systems architect, designing a modern, scalable architecture that integrates ERP, manufacturing, e-commerce and analytics. Define standards for APIs, data models and security.
Maintain a high attention to detail when reviewing system designs, code integrations and data flows; balance innovation with operational reliability.
Develop and execute an IT and product strategy aligned with business objectives. Plan and direct installations and upgrades, justify budgets and manage vendor relationships.

Evaluate the current ERP/MES environment. Determine whether a full rebuild, a phased modernization or targeted enhancements will best support the business. If a rebuild is warranted, lead the selection and implementation; if not, plan the modernization path.

Establish key performance indicators for the API platform (e.g., partner adoption, transaction volume) and for IT operations (uptime, help-desk resolution times). Use these metrics to guide prioritization.
Assess accumulated technical debt resulting from exceptions and one-off requests across legacy systems and services.
Develop and execute a remediation plan that addresses architectural inconsistencies, outdated code, fragile integrations and undocumented workflows.
Introduce governance processes and coding standards to prevent future technical debt.

Partner with a small team of developers and engineers, providing guidance on architecture, code review and technical problem-solving. Step in to prototype API endpoints, data schemas or integrations when needed.
Ensure data architecture supports both operational systems and analytics; oversee data engineers and database administrators.
Lead the design and evolution of customer and vendor portals; collaborate with UI/UX partners and internal developers to deliver intuitive experiences.

Oversee helpdesk and IT support operations to ensure prompt resolution of user issues and continuous improvement. Ensure the team has the tools, processes and training to deliver high-quality support.
Maintain high availability of networks, servers and manufacturing systems; coordinate preventive maintenance, disaster recovery and security measures.
Implement and monitor security and compliance practices; engage external auditors or managed-security services as needed.
Act as the main liaison between technology, product, operations, finance and external partners. Communicate complex architectural decisions in clear, business-oriented language.
Mentor team members and cultivate a culture of innovation, accountability and continuous learning.
CultureIndex: Ambitious and entrepreneurial spirit; commitment to user experience and data-driven decision-making; collaborative mindset; cultural alignment with company's Core Values; pride in dealing with customers and quality; support each other; bring it every day; do what's necessary for the company.
Qualifications: Experience: 10+ years in technology leadership roles with a proven track record of delivering API-centric products and leading ERP or manufacturing-system transformations.

Technical Breadth: Deep knowledge of enterprise architecture, API design, cloud platforms, data modeling and modern web development, ideally with experience in the company's current stack (C#, Python, PHP, Java, MySQL).
Product Management Mindset: Demonstrated ability to own a product roadmap, collect stakeholder feedback and drive adoption metrics.
Architect Personality: Combines visionary thinking with meticulous attention to detail; comfortable defining high-level strategy yet willing to dive into code, schema or infrastructure details.
Leadership: Strong communicator and motivator; able to build and lead small, cross-functional teams and manage vendors and contractors effectively.
